common.PolygonNew#

Classes

Polygon(p_id)

Stores data about one polygon and references to the drawn Patch.

PolygonManager(parent[, logger_options, ...])

Manages polygon creation, storage, and drawing on a Matplotlib axes.
class common.PolygonNew.Polygon(p_id)[source]#

Bases: object

Stores data about one polygon and references to the drawn Patch.

class common.PolygonNew.PolygonManager(parent, logger_options=None, logger_key=None)[source]#

Bases: object

Manages polygon creation, storage, and drawing on a Matplotlib axes. Includes save/load methods using the pickle module.

Methods

clear_polygons(axes)

Remove all polygons from the plot.

create_new_polygon()

Begin a new polygon by incrementing the ID and setting is_drawing=True.

distance_to_line_segment(px, py, x1, y1, x2, y2)

Returns min distance from (px,py) to line segment [ (x1,y1), (x2,y2) ].

finalize_polygon(axes)

Close the polygon by adding a patch to the axes.

find_nearest_vertex(click_x, click_y[, max_dist])

Return (polygon_id, vertex_index) for the nearest vertex if within max_dist, otherwise (None, -1).

handle_polygon_add_point_click(event, axes)

Insert a new vertex into the closest line segment of the selected polygon.

handle_polygon_click(canvas, event, axes[, ...])

Called by MplCanvas on mouse click in polygon mode.

handle_polygon_creation_click(event, axes)

If we are in creation mode, left-click => add point, right-click => finalize.

handle_polygon_move_click(event, axes)

If user is in "move polygon vertex" mode:

load_polygons(filepath, axes)

Load polygons from a file and re-draw them on the given axes.

save_polygons(filepath)

Save the current polygons to a file (using pickle).

update_polygon_patch(poly, axes)

Remove the old patch if present, create a new patch from updated points, and add it to axes.

update_polygon_vertex(polygon_id, ...)

Update a single vertex and re-draw the patch.
clear_polygons(axes)[source]#

Remove all polygons from the plot.

create_new_polygon()[source]#

Begin a new polygon by incrementing the ID and setting is_drawing=True.

distance_to_line_segment(px, py, x1, y1, x2, y2)[source]#

Returns min distance from (px,py) to line segment [ (x1,y1), (x2,y2) ].

finalize_polygon(axes)[source]#

Close the polygon by adding a patch to the axes.

find_nearest_vertex(click_x, click_y, max_dist=1.0)[source]#

Return (polygon_id, vertex_index) for the nearest vertex if within max_dist, otherwise (None, -1).

handle_polygon_add_point_click(event, axes)[source]#

Insert a new vertex into the closest line segment of the selected polygon. For simplicity, we pick one polygon as ‘current’ or we loop over polygons to find which one user is editing.

handle_polygon_click(canvas, event, axes, is_moving=False)[source]#
Called by MplCanvas on mouse click in polygon mode.

  • If is_moving=False => creation logic

  • If is_moving=True => pick up or place a vertex

handle_polygon_creation_click(event, axes)[source]#

If we are in creation mode, left-click => add point, right-click => finalize.

handle_polygon_move_click(event, axes)[source]#
If user is in “move polygon vertex” mode:

  1. If not picked up a vertex, find nearest vertex

  2. Otherwise, place it

load_polygons(filepath, axes)[source]#

Load polygons from a file and re-draw them on the given axes. Expects the same structure as produced by save_polygons.

save_polygons(filepath)[source]#

Save the current polygons to a file (using pickle). We’ll store just the polygon points in a dict: {p_id: [ (x,y), (x,y), … ]}.

update_polygon_patch(poly, axes)[source]#

Remove the old patch if present, create a new patch from updated points, and add it to axes.

update_polygon_vertex(polygon_id, vertex_idx, new_x, new_y, axes)[source]#

Update a single vertex and re-draw the patch.
